treatment.reference: Methanoplanus petrolearius sp nov, a novel methanogenic bacterium from an oil-producing well FEMS Microbiol Lett 147:51-56
treatment.description: Round colonies (diameter: 1-2 mm) are present after 3 weeks of incubation at 37˚C. Cells are irregular disc-shaped with a diameter of 1-3 µm. The cells occur singly or in pairs and are non-motile under microscope. Methanogenic and obligattely anaerobic member of the domain Archaea. The optimum temperature for growth is 37˚C with no growth occurring at 25˚C and 45˚C. The optimum pH is 7.0; growth occurs from pH 5.3 to 8.4. The optimum NaCl concentration for growth is between 1 and 3% NaCl with growth occurring at NaCl concentrations ranging from 0 to 5%. Doubling time is about 10 h under optimal conditions. Produces methane from H2-CO2, formate, and CO2+2-propanol, CO2+1-butanol, and isobutanol. The G+C content of the DNA is 50% (ad determined by HPLC). Isolated from oil-producing well. The type strain is SEBR 4847T (=OCM 486).
